cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles west of Cabo Cruz, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across central-western Cuba Monday, then turning NNW over the Florida Straits and tracking northward just offshore the west coast of Florida toward the Big Bend area Tuesday–Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf coast of Florida (likely Cedar Key–Big Bend region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: West coast of Florida from Flamingo northward to the Anclote River, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast, especially the Keys, southwest Florida and the Tampa Bay–Big Bend shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (gales) are possible at Port Manatee beginning late Tuesday with peak probabilities around 40%, sustained winds could reach 40–50 mph with higher gusts if the center hugs the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC storm-surge watch for Bonita Beach–Suwannee River (includes Tampa Bay) indicates 2–4 ft of inundation possible; 3–4 ft is plausible inside Tampa Bay and at Port Manatee.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with localized totals up to 6 inches Tuesday–Wednesday, producing flash/urban flooding risk around port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Scattered tornadoes possible Tuesday–Wednesday; rough seas and dangerous surf likely in Tampa Bay and approaches, causing significant navigation restrictions.
